review: We made reservations weeks ago to attend Red Robin's soft opening (they don't officially open until 8/24), where we received a complimentary meal, drinks, and appetizer.  I have to admit, I was very skeptical about this place, as I'm not a huge fan of chain restaurants, however, I was extremely impressed with how smooth and flawless our experience was, considering they were still in training. We have been to quite a few openings of new restaurants lately, and there have always been problems. We did not have one single issue at Red Robin.  Our server, Melissa (Missy), was friendly and efficient. Several staff members, including management, stopped by to check on us. Everyone was friendly and had a big smile. I appreciate the great customer service. Our food came out fast, and was beautifully presented, and exactly as we ordered it. Bus boys continually surveyed the tables looking for anything they could take away.  ***The Food*** To me, the food was just alright, nothing special. I ordered the BLTA Croissant, and it was tasty. I have ordered something similar at Applebees before, and Red Robin's was much better. The croissant was very fresh and delicious, and all of the toppings were fresh. My only complaint is that the turkey wasn't the best quality, which I guess it to be somewhat expected.  I ordered a side of chili, not expecting much, but oh my goodness was it good. It's spicy, but so delicious. My husband really enjoyed his food. He got a black and blue burger with a side of garlic fries. My daughter ordered the kids cheeseburger, and loved it. We will definitely be going back once they open later this month. You can tell they have worked really hard to have a great opening.

Had a great experience here. I was surprised at how quick and friendly the service was on opening day. I wish I could remember our servers name, because she was really amazing at her job. The food was absolutely perfect. We will definitely be back soon!

Chuckie Cheese look out. There is a new below average cheap place to bring the kids. If you like the sound of helium balloons being filled every 60 seconds, servers yelling across the building, soggy salads and crispy burgers, look no further. This place has been opened one week and it already is run down and filthy. It's all about expectations. If you get your head to a place where you are looking for a good noisy, dirty diner, then go to Denny's at 2 am. I am sure you will see some average reviews from high school students and parents who have found another kid friendly diner.

Went there for the first time today. I went with my mom and arrived a few minuets before they opened at 11:00 AM. We got seated right away, and our server came right over and took our orders of drinks. Me and my Mom shared a sandwich and fried and honestly were good! Our waiter was great and I will be going back soon!

Upon arrival on a Sunday evening we were told there would be a 20-25 min wait for 2. They took my cell number and said they'd text when our table was ready. There are no benches outside, and minimal seating on the inside- which is a very small area with the hostess podium also sharing the space. It is very chaotic in the lobby. After 20 mins we received our text and came back inside. The hostess told us to stand to the left- while she promptly seated 2 people she very obviously knew, even though they just walked in the door. (It is packed in here and families of 4/5 are waiting 45mins.) After 3-5 mins we were seated after witnessing our hostess and the girl seating us (Carmella) exchange words due to confusion on who was being seated when/where. Our server (Melissa) is pleasant, a little spacey, and hard to hear as she is in the process of losing her voice and it's quite noisy in here. It was about 20mins after placing our order for an Uberburger w/fries and a Tavern Double w/fries (mine) and side of brown gravy that our food arrived. I had ordered mine with no pink and I was pleased with the burger and with the gravy and fries. The gravy was dank! My husband asked for his burger with pink...It was pretty well done. He said it was just okay. Overall the food was decent, but the service and layout was confused and congested. I did see a server/seater named Courtney who was hustling like a champ. She was just in work mode and seemed to be one of the few who knew what she was doing. Also there was a gentleman (didn't see his name) with dreads and tattoos that was very informative to his tables as to how to use the Ziosk order/pay system and descriptive about menu items. He also seemed to be the leader for singing a Birthday song to a table and was extremely helpful and friendly. I really just wish that most of the staff would go and visit the Port Orange Red Robin that my husband and I have been to numerous times and see how well oiled of a machine it is. It's what made us wish we had one in Melbourne...hopefully they'll get their act together.

Went on a Friday night with my very pregnant friend. Being a new restaurant, we knew it would be busy and were willing to wait. The line was out the door and they said they would text me when they were ready for us. No place to sit outside, so we just went back and sat in the car. You could see via the link they gave you where in line you were, not surprisingly, parties of 6-8 people were waiting an hour+. They texted us and we were sat in only 15 minutes which was awesome. Appetizers and desserts you had to order on the little machine on the table which was simple enough to use. We ordered the donuts, chocolate fruffles and Bar Wings 'n' Yukon Chips. The wings were awesome, as were the donuts. I didn't care for the fruffles. By the time our food came I was stuffed. The two bites I did manage out of the Royal Red Robin was good. Also the spiked grasshopper was great. I have no complaints other then the water. It was nasty. I'd go there again, but definitely not with a lot of people unless you're willing to wait a long time.

I am a huge Red Robin fan, but this one left me not wanting to come back. We went last night which was a Wednesday night. It was very busy still but the wait staff was pushy. Wanting to get you to go boxs and clear the tables about 10 minutes after your food arrived. The food was just ok. If you are looking for a fast burger this is your place. I could have had the same burger and experience at Steak and shake across the street.

We love red robin so we were so happy to have one open right by us. When we got there it was well after dinner rush should of been over, but wow they were still super busy she said a 15 min wait but it as more like a 28 to 30 min wait, we always love the food so the wait is worth it.  Our server was wonderful, but the bus boy kept taking plates and drinks before we were finished. We will eat here again and have many more laughs here there bottomless sides are wonderful and our kids love coming here.

Greetings all! I'll begin with the pros: ordered Grilled Turkey Burger  delicious in spite of it being cold, the onion bun was fabulous. I removed the bottom of the bun because it was cold and a little hard. My Hun loved his BQ Burger! Cons: My order was taken incorrectly so that turned Into the wait time of 1hr 20mins. Called to speak with a manager and "Katrina" put me on hold for 15mins 30secs (1st call) I hung up and immediately called back a "Katrina" put me on hold again after she put me on hold again "Tyler" pick up and advised he would get a manager for me within minutes a manager came and advised no one told her until "Tyler" that she had a call and she gave us a $10.00 gift card and apologized for our inconvenience and gave us each a complementary drink (tea). The cup of clam chowder not pleased at all it was approximately 2 tablespoons and pushing when I say that much!!!! We will give "Red Robin" another chance because We have had better experiences at other locations so New Haven of Melbourne FL better step up!!!
Super slow service. Waitress never checked on us. Very disappointed. By far the worst red robin experience we've had

Food good. Service bad. If you like guessing where you're server is or red flashing lights then this is the place for you. I would rather have an overbearing waiter that refills my drink after every sip then watch the tumbleweeds roll by as a hawk screeches above the wasteland void of where my server is NOT standing. Seriously, though. I'm not asking much. This is my second time here, and it would be nice if someone would ask me if my food is cold enough. I'm thinking I'll take my sweet time coming back.
Over priced. Minimal portions. My burger was pitiful. Not much of a beer selection.  Service was good. Food was out quickly.  I would never go back.

Came in for lunch and they told us it would be 10 minutes it turned into 30 minutes simply because my daughter wasn't yet 21 so you can't sit on one half of the restaurant if youre under 21 the hostess gave us an attitude because we asked to see the manager. The manager was then rude to us and had an attitude. They are not very friendly or hospitable.  Or family friendly

Updated review.... After receiving a gift card I decided to try again... Staff was great.  You can see they are trying to improve.  Had good appetizers and an excellent drink from the bar.  (The TNT long Island) still not the best food but you can tell they are trying to get it together.  Cheers.

My husband and I had a great experience here! Keven our server was fantastic! Now on to the food.. we both ordered their mini blue cheese wedge and it was fantastic.. I really loved the fried onion strings on them.. will have to try that next time I make them at home.. then I had the guacamole burger.. cooked to perfection and the hubs had the fish and chips and he loved them!! Will will go back!

Our waiter was great. He was attentive, friendly and quick. We ordered the burgers, peppercorn and the other 'shroom. The mushroom was just ok but hubby liked the peppercorn one. We opted for onion rings. Those didn't have much flavor. There is an option to play games on the table's electronic order pad for 1.99. If I had children with me, would probably be worth it.
Not impressed after a long wait. Burger was ok, nothing special. The service is lacking and slow. They seem more about the customer turn over verses customer satisfaction. I may give it another shot.

Red Robins across America are incredible when the cooks and servers are on the ball. Unfortunately, this location is lagging far behind. The food is never hot and the order is usually screwed up in some way. I'll give them a second chance, eventually, but this new restaurant area at the mall is quickly becoming known for lousy service that can't keep up with the crowds.

We cancelled our name from the wait list.  The hostesses were making fun of customers that had came in and one had her hand down her pants as she was standing there. Last time we ate there we had terrible food, doubt the food is any better after not getting past the hostesses. This isn't how any Red Robin has been that I've been to before.  This one should change its name to not tarnish the franchise.  I'd give them 0 stars if I could, but you have to give one to post your review.

This restaurant is the worst eating establishment in Brevard County. Please take all the negative Yelp comments seriously. The food was cold and had no taste. It is way too expensive for hospital cafeteria food. The food at Red Robin is definitely is not gourmet. Our waiter Mario was the worst waiter I have ever had. In addition for a new restaurant this one is very dirty, especially the restrooms. Now I will expand on this. It was a 20 minute wait with limited seating in the hostess area and the exterior of building. Once seated it took 15 minutes for our waiter Mario to take our drink order and at the same time my wife ordered a french onion soup. Since Red Robin offers a kiosk system at their tables, I felt Mario should have taken the time to explain how it worked. The french onion soup came out with our drinks and the onions were hard and uncooked which was bad enough but there was a large piece of onion skin in the bowl as well. A disgusting way to start a meal. It took 15 minutes before Mario returns to our table to take our order. And then the wait began. 34 minutes later, Mario strolls back to our table and ask us if we wanted dessert. "Dessert I said, I want our meal" which still had not come out to the table. Not only did Mario not have a clue that we never received our food, he actually never came back to check to see if everything was correct and to ask if we needed anything else. Let's get to the "gourmet" food now. The kids Kraft Mac & cheese was ice cold. My whiskey burger had no taste, was cold as well, and came with 6 steak fries. I should add that it was not much bigger than a slider. You would get a better burger at White Castle or Krystal's! Where is the endless basket of fries they advertise famously on television? Because I over heard the lady sitting at the table next to ours complain about her fries being cold, I requested that for mine to be well done so they would be hot which they weren't. As for my wife's chicken sandwich, I will stick to Chick-fil-A next time. What I think happened is Mario forgot our food in the window and by the time he was told by us, it was cold. Instead of re-firing the order, Mario chose to serve it anyway. No one during this entire time stopped by our table, not even a manager. Finally, the hostess walking by heard us talking and asked me what was wrong. I told her everything that that happened and she did offer to have the manager come over but I just wanted to leave at that point. 2 minutes later I heard our waiter Mario comment to one of the other employees that we could go find better service next time at another restaurant. He said this at a distance I could hear him and in front of other guests. I then decided to speak to the manager, Kim, because enough is enough and Mario crossed the line with his comment. I plan on calling the corporate office tomorrow with regards to this experience. This location is so bad I would not recommend taking your worst enemy there to eat.

Well where to start but there is no place like home . The food was great the staff was friendly the waiter was pretty good for only having two tables .... the bad the very bad 5 tables in the whole place 58 mins to get our food and 10 mins to get extra frys which was hot... so if your not in a hurry stop in..
I love red robin the service was very good ny waiter  name Brian  very professional  overall  nice guy

I went to red robin for a quick lunch...I probably made a wrong move and went with a salad instead of the burger which they are known for. Asian Salad reminded me of bagged dole salad thrown on a plate with some chicken and one pineapple ring and maybe 4 pieces of mandarin orange, they also didn't give me any garlic toast which it was to come with. Manager did not visit my table to apologize when I complained to server I won't be back.

I eat a Red Robin all over the Midwest and South and I must say that this was the worse one I have ever been to. First off we got seated and then proceeded to wait 15 min before our waitress, Melissa, came and got our drink order. After we waited another 10 to 15 min for our drinks and appetizers to arrive we waited another 15 min for her to come and take our food order. After another  30 min our food arrived all of the fries were cold and my sister in laws chicken sandwich tasted spoiled. Since we couldn't find Melissa we told  another waitress that the chicken was bad. Finally Melissa came by and asked what was wrong with the chicken so we told her and she said that she had the chicken sandwich earlier and it was fine. Well at this point we were extremely upset over the crappy service. We sat there for 20 min waiting to see Melissa and ask for our check so when we didn't see her we used the kiosk at the table and left. Needless to say we will not be back to this Red Robin.

I have been here 2 times. Both times the wait was ridiculously long (37 minutes the second time for a 30 minute estimated wait on 1 adult, 1 child.) and the front end staff gives the impression that they have better things to do.Ill focus on the second visit since it's the better of the two. When we are finally seated, to their credit it wasn't another 20 minute wait for a server, it was instantaneous , although we waited 25 minutes after ordering our appetizer.. The server was very friendly, and attentive to my 8 yr. Old nephew but did not come around often. 2 minutes after aps(I had to stop my server to check on) show up....in come the entrées. It took 20 more minutes to give our desert order. They kept directing me to the order screen on the table but I have no interest, and let my server know that. Our deserts came 15 minutes apart, and I ended up having mine packed up, (I asked for a refund but I guess he misheard me, and I just wanted to end this 2 hour debacle). I only ordered it because my nephew ordered something. All in all good food HORRIBLE service model. I imagine they cut staffing for this table side electro - ordering device, and in my eyes it's a big zero! It's been a frustrating venture both times, and despite the genuineness, and kindness of our waiter, he wasn't around much. Service shouldn't come across as a burden in a resteraunt, for these reasons, you couldn't drag me back in there.

We got in right away, seated in the main dinning area. Our waitress greeted us promptly and got our drinks promptly. We ordered the voodoo frys for appetizer on the box and got them while the waitress was taking or dinner order. The patty melt was great. The mushroom burger had more mushrooms on it then I've ever seen and was delicious. The seafood dinner my son got was good, the fish was nicely done. My mom's burger was average. Overall a good experience, much better than prior reviews would suggest.

Food was fine if you like pressed meat. 20 min. wait at 2pm in the afternoon on a Saturday. We ended up eating at the bar just so we could sit down.  Shelby, the bartender, was obviously having a bad day and she even told us all about it. She and a server, Michelle took every opportunity to complain to one another the entire time we were at the bar. Food order arrived after quite a wait...my guacamole bacon cheeseburger was good, onion rings were awesome. My husband ordered the smoked (something) burger and said it was great. He asked for more "bottomless" fries and we would have finished eating long before they arrived but he saved half of his burger so he'd have something to eat with them so,  of course his burger got cold waiting. Never had any problems at other locations in the past and have no desire to return to the Melbourne location again.

Came in and was immediately seated. It wasn't too busy, just about 3 other tables with people, so we figured we were pretty lucky we came in so early. I ordered the bonsai salad, while my dad ordered the fish and my son and mom ordered a burger. After about 25ish minutes, our server asked if we wanted some fries while we waited. I should've know something was up when they asked that because we've never been asked that before.  Another server comes up and basically drops half a basket of fries on the table. No plates, and they're cold. This night is getting better and better.  Our server comes to seat another table and asked if we got the fries, and I let him know yes and they were cold. He apologizes and gets another order going for us. Those are hot, but again, no plates. My mom tries to ask him for Tobasco sauce, but he doesn't hear, so I get up to go get it.  We waited one hour, I know this because Sol checked when we ordered.  And guess what? They gave me a burger.....not even interested anymore. I know I asked for the salad because my server asked what kind of dressing I wanted, and I opened the menu to show him the page and verify it did come with dressing.  I sent the burger back and had them remove it from the bill. No dinner for me tonight. My dad's fish was good, and the burgers were ok. (My son commented on how everything was unbalanced. Like half of the burger had nothing on it. I'm assuming nothing was wrong with the taste because he inhaled it.)  Off night? Perhaps. Because it's fairly new? Maybe. I've never had any issues with any other red robin in the years we've been to RR.  Now off to find something to eat in the kitchen.

First time cant believe how pricy the food is for just burgers and fries.  Order was wrong do to waiter not writing anything down and I didn't want to use the computer on the table to order my food.  Isn't that why they have servers?  If we wanted anything the serve kept directing us to the device on the table to use.  To much chatting between the staff and very loud at that.  If your going to force customers to use those tablets on the table then why have servers it's very frustrating.

This is my second time here and I feel better about this experience. I always give a second and third chance when it comes to eating establishments. The first time I came was during the soft opening and it was overly hectic (which was to be somewhat expected) and I did not like having a pressed burger.  This time around we were quoted a 25 to 30 minute wait for seating, however we only waited about 15 minutes. (It was packed but lively and moving.) We ended up waiting around 20 minutes for our food. This time I had the Garden burger and sweet potato fries. Boy! Whoever was in the kitchen tonight had a heavy hand! My burger was VERY spicy. It was loaded with dijon dressing. I love spicy food, but holy sh*t! The sweet potato fries were perfectly cooked but salty. Great portions, just a bit sloppy. Our waiter was attentive, friendly and answered every question we had. My daughter is usually very apprehensive with any stranger but our waiter got her to open right up.  We all agreed we'd be coming back.

Don't eat here! The hostess who handles your silver wear was wiping her noses with her hand then scratching her head and then handling patrons silver wear and menus. Cooks were walking through the dining room scratching there genitals and returning to work without washing their hands. Needless to say hopefully it's a matter of time till the health department gets involved.

If you are under any time constraints this is not the place for you.  We got a table immediately. But after fifteen minutes we still hadn't heard from our server. It was about 12:00 on a Friday but there were only five other tables in use out of about thirty or thirty-five tables. We had never been there before so we figured maybe we had to ring for our server when we were ready, on the little device that was on the table. So we did. The server who answered our call asked if we needed anything and we said "Yeah, we would like to order" and she told us "YOUR server should be here shortly" and left.  After another ten minutes a girl came to our table to get our order. She asked if we wanted our sons order brought out first and we said yeah that would be nice, he's kind of a slow eater it would be good to get him started. I might add that this was the last time we saw our server until after we had already paid with their automated device and were walking out the door. His mac-n-cheese (Kraft style), oranges, and apple juice came out about ten minutes later and he had time to finish everything and get restless (about another thirty minutes) before our food came. We are now over an hour and just receiving our food.  The burgers were mediocre and the fry portion could fit in the palm of my hand, yes they are "bottomless" but you have to have a server attending your table in order to get your refill.  For burgers we will instead be spending our time and money at 5 Guys or The Burger Place for better burgers.

I gave this place a second chance and tried a Deluxe burger this time. I have to tell you I am disappointed in the quality and the cost. Five Guys, Steak and Shake and even Burger King burgers are tastier. I wouldn't mind paying $10 to $14 for a good burger but I was not happy with a grey piece of something that is supposed to be beef.  They also tried to add 1.99 entertainment fee for some cheap games on a tabletop device we did not play. It does have fine print staying the fee but we did not agree to it and had to get the manager to remove the charge. The wait staff and Manager treated us fine. They do have a few good choices for side dishes. I had fruit salad that cost only $0.49 extra and refills for sides are unlimited although we did not reorder and the waitress did not ask if we wanted more. Also, $8.99 is high for a 28 oz draft beer. What happened to Red Robin? I had been to a few when traveling  out of state years ago and they were great.
Sat down at the bar, created and served in a reasonable time. Beer was cold food was hot.

My mom and I stopped in for my last meal before I started my diet. Lol!  Who can miss having a beer and burger!!!! Due to wait times, we opted to sit in the bar area which was bit of a tight squeeze.  But it allowed us to order pretty quickly.  However, the wait time for the good seemed to be a little on the long side considering we only ordered burgers... I opted for the Southern Charm Burger.  The cost was about $14.  Included candied bacon, carmalized onions, cheddar cheese, and bbq sauce.  To me it was just ok. I would have liked for the bacon to have more falvor and the kitchen skimped on the onions.  My mom had the Royal Red Robin and she said it was good, but she would have liked for the egg to be cooked a minute longer.  I opted for the garlic fries for the up charge, and they were tasty. Overall, it was a little pricy for burgers and fries in my opinion.  The beef was tasty but nothing spectacular.  I'd give them another try to taste some of the happy hour plates.

What can I say three visits and my favorite place has been a complete pile of crap. Listen to the other reviews. The only thing that will go well is getting seated.  Took 15 mins to take drink orders, then I got my food prior to getting my drinks. Everything is cold. So I have come to the conclusion that the manager of this store does not have a clue how to train anyone. Everything shows up late, takes for ever and where is the wait staff? They just disappeared over and over. I wish I could say it was a flook, but this review is based on several visits.
We have been  there twice now both times we had Awesome burgers service is Great Always an Enjoyable Experience.
Good burgers great onion rings keep it up I was happy with food and service.

When I lived in Virginia, Red Robin was our absolute go to place for a good meal! The one we went to had an open kitchen where you could see them make your food and it was always A+. So imagine my enthusiasm when I found out that there would be a Red Robin going into Melbourne!  First visit was only a couple weeks after their opening.  We hit them at an off time to avoid waiting. Our server was decent and experience was good. Just good. Food was not as good as I had remembered but chalked it up to opening quirks.  This past Saturday was our second visit. The experience started off promising as our server seemed friendly. That quickly went down hill. Appetizer was really slow to come out. I ordered an alcoholic drink but after wanted a water with my meal. I had to ask 6 times. Fiancé ordered a beer, got the wrong beer but drank it anyways since he thought it would be more of a hassle to get the server. Burgers took forever to come out and were horribly greasy. He asked for a refill on his fries. 20 minutes later no fries. At this point in time our server is flat out ignoring our table. Pretty much hoping we'd pay on the ziosk machine and leave. Flagged down another staff member who brought out cold fries. Server came over and asked if we were paying by card or cash. Basically just assumed because he had ignored us for over 20 minutes that we didn't want anything else. I asked for a manager who came over, thanked us for the feedback, handed us a free appetizer card and left. It was the most "I could care less" attitude I've ever seen.  Upon checking my receipt later on I realized that we were charged $7.79 for a beer!! The wrong beer at that!! Yes, I should have looked closer at the restaurant but I wanted to leave.  I am genuinely not surprised that this place has some horrible reviews.

Well I don't know about others but... This was my first time at a Red Robin  ever.. This was an awesome experience.. Bottomless fries is amazing and the burger was great... The server was awesome and playful we didn't have to wait long on our food we had a party of 6... Can't wait to visit again :)

We didn't have the wait or service problems everyone else complained about. Probably waited less than 15 minutes from sit down to food being delivered.  I ordered the mushroom burger, my husband had a bacon cheeseburger with an egg. He liked it more than I did. I thought the meat lacked flavor and juiciness compared to other burger places. I didn't think it was terrible, but I certainly wouldn't chose it as my first place to eat. They did have a full bar (although we don't drink) and the milkshakes looked yummy. It was slightly pricier than I think the quality allows for. Overall better than McDonald's, but not as good as Burger21 or Five Guys.

I've been to a few RR's and had high expectations for this location since it recently opened close to me.  Unfortunately, this was not the RR experience I'm familiar with.  I'll start off by admitting that this was my first time here and it might just have been a crazy off day.  I came with some friends who have been here, however, and they said their best experience was a 6 on a 10 scale so I'm guessing not. All that aside, the service was slow, we had to correct the waiter several times, our fries weren't fresh, and the sandwiches looked messy.  Table-wise, the seasoned salt shaker was empty, the ketchup was empty, and the table tablet was sticky with something I don't even want to discuss.  We ordered shakes at the end (through the tablet after we cleaned it) and he asked us if we wanted them to go, we said yes, and he brought them in glasses.  It was just one of those days.
This place is so much better than when it first opened! The artichoke spinach dip is amazing. The garlic fries were wonderful and the wedge salad was great. The service was great also.

Went for the first time with family. The service was fine considering the size of our party. Ordered the pretzel bite with beer cheese appetizer the cheese tasted scorched like the bottom of the pot was burned and then mixed in to the rest of the cheese. Sent it back and was told it was remade fresh but it still tasted the same. The burger was ok but not anything special. The fries were good and hot, including the free refill. All in all a pretty mediocre experience all around.

Gave it 2 shots- No More! Won't be going back to this location. I've been to several Red Robins & was always happy but this is the worst one. First time was not too long after they opened, so chalked up the long wait, over cooked burgers & forgetful waitress to that. Visited again recently & nothing has changed. Tavern burger is just gross. Two dry, tiny, thin patties with no seasoning other than fake smoke taste. Looked so ridiculous on the plate with this big bun and no meat. I am not even exaggerating- Burger King is better & I don't even like Burger King. Friend got the supposed 1/2 lb angus burger which was well done when asked for medium. Maybe was 1/2 lb before cooking it to death?Not at all worth $12 something. Waitress was nice but forgot to check on us & bring items we needed. Only thing good were the onion rings. What a shame- I have gift certificates but will hold on to them till I'm near another RR. You are a burger place that can't cook burgers. Why can't you get your act together here?

Awful service.  Server was too busy talking to the bartender to pay attention go her customers.  Food was cold, sent it back.. Drinks took 15 minutes to get. Server forgot to put them in.  Used to love this place.  I'll go elsewhere from now on.  This happened about a month ago.  Gave them another shot. The server was great, but she was waiting on every table in the dining room! The place was a mess.   Plates all stacked up on the table next to us, fries all over the floor... Food was cold again...

Red Robin has good ads but the food is far more expensive than it is worth. The fries were greasy or over cooked. The buns fell apart... Waitress says she doesn't eat beef, wonder why? Not going back, but will go to 5 Guys for better food and less money. Plus we had to race to the bathroom when we got home... 'nuf said.

DO NOT waste your money going to this place. There are so many better choices in Melbourne that won't rob you blind and make you sick! My boyfriend and I went there a few days ago (first time) and the burgers and fries were horrible! The fries were cold and when they brought out more, they were soaked in grease! For what we paid for one burger, we could have gotten a steak from a local steakhouse. A Whopper from BK would have been more satisfying than the $15 burger here. Two gross burgers w/ nasty fries and one soda was $36! Total RIP OFF!! We will never go back. They should rename this Red Robbery! Go to Five Guys if you want to save money and enjoy your food.

What happened???? I stopped by here with a group of family members and it was an embarrassment. Seating was slow. Food was slow. Food quality and taste is poor. Service was slow and couldnt seem to get it together. Was observing other tables and it wasn't just us. Other customers seemed frustrated too. This establishment has gone down hill. Never again.

Like I usually do, I give restaurants a "second chance" to improve. Apparently, Red Robin has its "too big to fail" attitude to think it doesn't need to improve, well at least the branch on US 192 in front of Melbourne Square Mall. I recently went here with my cousin Myra as I was treating her out for her birthday after we went to church together. She chose to eat her and I obliged. Skipping the decor since I detailed that last time, I will go straight to the food. The time it took to make did not take long, but now the lack of decorum with said food is accompanied by an unsatisfactory taste. I took one bite of my grilled four-cheese sandwich with a burger patty and I was disgusted. Thinking it was me following the waiter's preference to add said burger patty into the sandwich, I took it out and ate it as if it were made to order. Not much of a difference. Maybe it will taste better with chicken but I will not know. Only positives were the unlimited orange creme sodas and the friendliness of our waiter Brian. He was so nice and very funny. Our preferences on food don't match, but that does not negate the fact I will most-likely ask to be waited by him if I ever, for some reason beyond me, go back to Red Robin... which I will most-likely won't.

The food was perfect and the service was great! We dined before the rush at about 5PM on a Friday. Our burgers were very good. The server was knowledgeable and was sure to make sure we were aware of the options and special sauces that were available. I would frequent this restaurant all the time if it wasn't such a drive from north Brevard! We'll be sure to stop by again when we're in the area and looking to dine somewhere!
Brian Anderson was an awesome server and he made the food even better with his attentiveness and genuineness!  Thanks for making a good meal, great!

A friend and I went here for a quick nice dinner. We both got their classic bacon burger. The server was wonderful and very attentive to our needs. He was always quick to give suggestions about burgers and menu items. I thought my burger was cooked perfectly and the meat was of excellent quality. It was genuinely a phenomenal burger. The fries that came with the burger were also very delicious. If you didn't know, the fries at Red Robbin are bottomless. Our waiter kept asking if he could refill our fries and my friend and I were confused and kept saying no. I decided to question him about the request and he said it was free refills on fries.  I would encourage anyone who loves a good burger to check this place out. They have a great variety of burgers for any burger lovers to choose from. I believe they also had some vegetarian options, but I don't play those games so didn't check that out.

This is a decent non fast food burger plus restaurant. There were only two servers so they were a bit overwhelmed.  I ordered their new special avocado chicken wedge -- which is is basically a grilled chicken breast topped with a few slices of avocado and tomato wrapped in iceberg lettuce. No bun. I opted for no onions and the ranch dressing on the side but they put the dressing on anyway. I deconstructed it and ate it like a salad -- requesting extra blue cheese dressing after the fact. It also came with a side salad (redundant?) which I switched to steak fries. Get the fries well done and you'll be pleased. Drinks and fries are bottomless here, but can't imagine doing so unless you are a very hearty eater. The food was good; the kitchen a bit slow; the severs a bit overwhelmed. So it took a bit longer for lunch than expected. I'd probably still go back if I was craving a good burger and in the area.

This place sucked. The bar smelled like a dirty bar rag, the floor was slippery & our table was sticky. We should have left before ordering but..... $23 dollars later equaled one subpar blue cheese burger, a coke & dry Mac & cheese. The server never said that Mac & cheese was an upgrade of a side, but when we questioned that, we were told to speak to the manager. Run, don't walk away from this place.
service was great and so was the food. thanks Brittany.awesome bartender and was helpful in selecting my me and was doll and brought me sauces for my fries. wow

I went here with my husband. We left early because the waitress was rude and awkward. Usually I have more patience but, I couldn't handle her that evening. She spoke to us like we were an inconvenience to her and she didn't know much about the menu (or she didn't care enough to answer our questions). The food was fine but, nothing special. I had a tortilla soup and the husband had a burger. We ended up taking our food to go because I was so irritated with the waitress and the music was too loud. We have been to another location in another city before and the service was much better and atmosphere was enjoyable. This was our first experience at this location. We may try it again in case it was just the one bad server, but not any time soon. The restraunt itself was clean and well decorated.

well to be honest when we walked in and they sat us in the room with all loud kids i should of said something then ,but a dad of 2 grown children i was willing to try, then we got 2 burgers and fries and 2 waters and spent over 35.00 so do not buy the gourmet burgers buy the 6.99 ones they are bigger and better. or just do not go.

Having grown up in Washington State I've been to many Red Robins. This one by far has the best service of any of the Red Robins I've been to. Our server Bryan is the nicest guy, and because of him I keep coming back every time I'm in Melbourne.

This was my first and last visit to Red Robin. I don't know if its just this location that's mismanaged or if they're not really that good under any circumstances but I'm unwilling to find out. I've had better burgers at McDonald's and that's not saying much. Service was meh, the entire place is grimy and needs a good scrub from top to bottom, my "gourmet" Southern Charm burger was both greasy AND burnt, (all 3 burgers at my table, one from each "level", were falling apart from the grease) and to top it all off there were no paper towels in the ladies room. Horrible, avoid at all costs. The fries were edible. That's about the nicest thing I can say.

Thank you for taken good care of St. Leo University Softball team.. excellent service.. Job well done.. food was right on target! Thanks again... The Bus Driver... This place can handle big groups.. no problem..
2 Beers, Side of Onion Rings: $25 Didn't order the $10 Gardenburger because they said they microwave them. Onion rings tasted like they were out of a bag from Walmart. Will never go back.

Ill start off by saying that the service was great. However $34 for 2 burgers, fries, fried pickles and a drink is way out of my everyday budget. How on earth is a burger $14.99??? Unless they are prime rib, which they are not, this is highway robbery and not gourmet. I was not impressed by the food at all.
Great burger place! Lauren was a great server, one of the best ive had. Very attentive to our table, kept the drinks and fries coming but wasn't overbearing. All the staff was great
The food is okay not great it's too dang expensive lower your prices please thanks the Service is not that great as well it's just not good food Is okay

I was pleasantly surprised.  I have never been to one and was a little blown away when I walked in, was expecting a more open space but this worked well, a little more quaint I guess.  I got the Original Burger I think it was called, according to the story it was what made them famous, so...it was really good.  Good steak fries.  That burger, fries, and one Bud Light was $14Ish, I know the beer was $3.50 so if your a soda drinker or have kids in tow it's fairly reasonable.  The burger was $9.99.  I thought it was a good burger for sure.  I liked the story behind the name Red Robin, I can see that.  It's safe for kids I would say, they have a full bar on display to see, but have a dinning area where that is not in view: the back of the bar acts as a wall.  It's cool, glad I stopped.
Traveling north, on Mother's Day.  Friendly service.  Amazing menu.  We tried burgers and were very happy.

Very good burgers and variety of them They even have veggie burgers, chicken and fish sandwiches.  The fries is definitely one of the best.  I am surprised at their low rating.  May be people are having bad experience with servers than the food!  Prices are known so complaints about the price is unfair.  But the service is definitely an issue.  Our server was great but couple of other servers who brought stuff out to us had attitude.
WAY OVERPRICED good service but the FOOD is not worth price at all. I can just go over to steak and shake for the exact thing for literally half the price maybe even less.

We tried this place for the first time, and what a great place for a burger and fries! Only $7 for the burger and fries.. and fries are unlimited! Onion rings have a great flavor, not sure what the dipping sauce was that cake with them but yummmmm! Definitely one our top restaurant and we will be coming back!

Unfortunately, my fiancé, son and myself could not enjoy our Red Robin experience so to speak. The waitress didn't acknowledge us at first, for taking care of the exiting tables drink order after we'd been there for almost 15 mins. We just wanted to have a nice dinner as a family and it was just one disappointment after another. We were excited to go here but $50 later for some burgers and fries. Totally wasn't what we expected from the place. Maybe it was the staff that day didn't care but we won't be going back.

We had the BEST server, Tasha!! It was the 1st time for both of us. The food was hot & Delish!! Tasha kept our drinks filled and her sense of humor kept us laughing.  The zucchini and mushroom appetizers were outstanding, our burgers were awesome & you can't beat bottomless fries. She showed us how to log on to create an account and I have a birthday coming up so that is very handed... like the commercial says... yummmmmm

Went to Red Robbins for the first time back in April. We have tried to go in the past but the wait times were always long especially with kids. Our wait time this time was suppose to be 20-30 mins but was really 10-15 mins. Great food, wonderful waiter (need I say his name too), and good environment. I had two kids with me and my husband. Everyone loved the food. My son (1 years old with an NG tube) had a restricted diet and the menu was good enough for him. Accommodations were also made for him because of his allergies as well. Greatly appreciated. We all went him full and happy. Anything involving their fries and garlic is excellent. We had three refills and I don't eat that much fries. Can't wait to come back again!

I don't mind Red Robin they are decent restaurants with pretty decent burgers. My server was in bad but my server wasn't great either. I took about 10 mins to get to my table and it wasn't that busy. However, she got my beer and my appetizer out pretty quickly. I ordered a Burger can't remember what kind it wasn't bad but I ordered a medium and a defiantly came out medium rare. I don't mind Medium rare  but That is not what I Ordered. After that I wasn't quite done and she told me to pay with the little tablet on the table which is kind of cool can be convenient however was also kind of Impersonal for Me Too! And then I had a problem with that tablet and wich it made it awkward Because she still wouldn't just take my card should go find the right one to make it work. Over all wasn't too bad the guy I'm not the kind of guy to just complain. The service just seemed a little in personal for me.

I used to eat at Red Robin quite often out west.  I have no plans of returning to this one. The burgers were okay but nothing like I remembered.  The fries were good.  My side salad was a joke (see photo.)

I really enjoy going to this place. My first time was last year for my birthday and I ended up getting a free Burger which was really awesome. They signed me up for a rewards card to earn products. The service was fast and efficient and the food was cooked very well and cooked to my liking. Also having endless fries is always a bonus. I would have to say their prices are worth what you pay. And then this year I went around my birthday again among other times and then I got a free Burger when my husband and I were there. The only thing that I didn't like was the fact that we were sitting next to a crying baby that the parents wouldn't take outside and have her to see for the other patrons in the establishment. Then to add to that on the other side of us was a drunk guy with two young girls who is speaking way too loud and the girl who is doing drinks was encouraging him which really wasn't a smart idea. But something like that is not what the establishment can fully control. You are what you make of the area and I have to say this is definitely a really good one

Well this place was just terrible our server was fantastic o must say but the food was worse than a $1 burger from McDonald's. We both ordered the premium burgers which looked nothing like the pics the burgers had an extremely small patty it was thrown together. The fries were really nice and the sauces were good but overall I could have gone through a drive thru and had a better meal.. maybe the 6.99 burgers are just as good but I won't be back to try

Having been to one in mass when,we lived up there expected good service and food. Boy were we disappointed. First, sat quickly but took the waitress 10,mins to take our water order to start before we even got to order drinks. Another 10 mins to order drinks which we decided to order fried pickle app and our entrees since we didn't want to sit another 20 mins without anything. Well, after a total of 25 mins sitting there,I saw the mgr drop our app near the cooking area so 5 mins later we got over fried pickles and the worse part is HE delivered them and thought nothing of it. The waitress 2 mins later delivered our food. Suprise,... Took the pickles wothout even asking if we wanted to replace them anf took them off the order. Food was notttttttt good at all. And to boot the. Waitress never came back until we were done. I ordered the cheesecake slice and she added hot fudge, strawberry sauce and cherry sauce. For the price, not worth it. Tip was more than I should have given but she can thank my wife for that. Would NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. SORRY

Well for startwrs it was my first and only visit service from a girl named ashely was great manager was accomidating but burgers came to table soagy lettuce was so soagy like it had been sitting it was 15 mins to7 o.m. christmas eve..food went back two times second time ot went vack i was told tgat tgey closed at 7 and tgeir major equiptment was turned off and that it would take extra time to get it back. I then cancelled my order and recived a discount but still paid 50 for my dinner never eaten..then was given a 20 gift card for a place i would never return to....i say red robin. Yummm not more like yuck and no concwrn for customers only themselves and going home that night...i went to 7 11 abd bought a hot dog for a 50 dinner that i payed for and didnt even get to taste anytging buta raw burger
